item.description:
Ride the ferry to Peaks Island in Casco Bay!

Back by popular demand:

The Original Peaks Island Walkabout...

We'll hike around this small but beautiful island catching views of lighthouses, Casco Bay, and the open ocean. Peaks is a residential island only one mile wide and a two miles long so it'll be a snap to see most of the island on foot in a few hours.

The ferry ride is a relaxing 15 minutes from Portland. Then, from the dock we'll walk through town, up woodland paths, along the coast, and over a beach or two for a +/- 5-mile roundtrip that will bring us back to a restaurant by the water. We'll eat and drink to our hearts' content and maybe watch the sunset before boarding the ferry back to Portland.

And...once there, Portland's Old Port is at our feet with shops, pubs, and restaurants - and a two-floor, three-bar, Ri~Ra Irish pub a very short walk away...!

Ferry Fare/Schedule: $4.10 roundtrip - off season adult.


Ferry Departs Portland @ Noon!

Boats don't wait for stragglers!

Return Ferry: 3:45, 5, 6, 7:45, etc.

Parking: Park at the city parking garage next to the ferry terminal - It's #7 on this map.

Please Carpool! If you want to meet at places other than below, post comments.

Newburyport Carpool: 10 AM. C&J Bus lot, 90 Storey Ave/Rt 113 at I-95. (Post a comment if you want to meet here.)

Portsmouth Carpool: 10:15 AM @ Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Ave. Meet in the back of the carpool lot - 2nd right off Grafton Ave.

*Please share gas & parking expenses with your driver.*

WEATHER! If a boat ride does not seem like a good idea for any reason, we'll hike Portland's East Prom Trail around its scenic waterfront and explore Old Town shops, pubs, fish markets, and restaurants.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

*Unless otherwise specified, refunds for timely cancellations will be processed the day after the event.

*Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Peaks Island Walkabout!
